p.text: The Commonwealth Act includes a definition of this term.
means a previous representation that is:
made by a person who is or becomes a party to a proceeding (including a defendant in a criminal proceeding), and
adverse to the person's interest in the outcome of the proceeding.
is defined in section 59 .
in relation to a defendant in a criminal proceeding, means a person against whom a prosecution has been instituted, but not yet completed or terminated, for:
an offence that arose in relation to the same events as those in relation to which the offence for which the defendant is being prosecuted arose, or
an offence that relates to or is connected with the offence for which the defendant is being prosecuted.
includes the external Territories.
means:
the High Court, or
a court exercising federal jurisdiction, or
a court of a State or Territory, or
a judge, justice or arbitrator under an Australian law, or
a person or body authorised by an Australian law, or by consent of parties, to hear, receive and examine evidence, or
a person or body that, in exercising a function under an Australian law, is required to apply the laws of evidence.
means a law of the Commonwealth, a State or a Territory.
See clause 9 of Part 2 of this Dictionary for the meaning of "law".
has the meaning it has in the Legal Profession Act 2004 .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]
has the meaning it has in the Legal Profession Act 2004 .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]
means a proceeding (however described) in an Australian court or a foreign court.
means Parliament, the Parliament of the Commonwealth or another State or the Legislative Assembly of a Territory.
has the meaning it has in the Legal Profession Act 2004 .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]
has the meaning it has in the Legal Profession Act 2004 .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]

means the Australian Statistician referred to in section 5(2) of the Australian Bureau of Statistics Act 1975 of the Commonwealth, and includes any person to whom the powers of the Australian Statistician under section 12 of the Census and Statistics Act 1905 of the Commonwealth have been delegated.
is defined in clause 1 of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
of a party means the facts in issue in respect of which the party bears the legal burden of proof.
means a child of any age and includes the meaning given in clause 10(1) of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
is defined in clause 3 of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
means a proceeding other than a criminal proceeding.
is defined in section 117 .
means evidence of a kind referred to in section 98(1) that a party seeks to have adduced for the purpose referred to in that subsection.
means section 98(1) .
means a body corporate that, were the Commonwealth a body corporate, would, for the purposes of the Corporations Act 2001 of the Commonwealth, be:
a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Commonwealth, or

a wholly-owned subsidiary of another body corporate that is, under this definition, a Commonwealth owned body corporate because of the application of paragraph (a) (including the application of that paragraph together with another application or other applications of this paragraph).
[def am Act 34 of 2001 Sch 4]
means a record made by:
a Department within the meaning of the Public Service Act 1999 of the Commonwealth, or
the Parliament, a House of the Parliament, a committee of a House of the Parliament or a committee of the Parliament, or
a person or body other than a Legislative Assembly holding office, or exercising power, under or because of the Commonwealth Constitution or a law of the Commonwealth, or
a body or organisation other than a Legislative Assembly, whether incorporated or unincorporated, established for a public purpose:
by or under a law of the Commonwealth or of a Territory (other than the Australian Capital Territory, the Northern Territory or Norfolk Island), or
by the Governor-General, or
by a Minister of the Commonwealth, or
any other body or organisation that is a Commonwealth owned body corporate,

and kept or maintained by a person, body or organisation of a kind referred to in paragraph (a) , (b) , (c) , (d) or (e) , but does not include a record made by a person or body holding office, or exercising power, under or because of the Commonwealth Constitution or a law of the Commonwealth if the record was not made in connection with holding the office concerned, or exercising the power concerned.
[def am Act No 53 of 2000 Sch 1]
is defined in section 117 .
is defined in section 117 .
means NSW court.
NSW court is defined in this Dictionary.
The Commonwealth Act does not include this definition.

of a person who has made a representation that has been admitted in evidence means the credibility of the representation, and includes the person's ability to observe or remember facts and events about which the person made the representation.
[def insrt Act 55 of 1997 s 3 and Sch 1]

of a witness means the credibility of any part or all of the evidence of the witness, and includes the witness's ability to observe or remember facts and events about which the witness has given, is giving or is to give evidence.
is defined in section 101A .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[82], effective 1 January 2009]
means section 102 .
means a prosecution for an offence and includes:
a proceeding for the committal of a person for trial or sentence for an offence, and
a proceeding relating to bail,
but does not include a prosecution for an offence that is a prescribed taxation offence within the meaning of Part III of the Taxation Administration Act 1953 of the Commonwealth.
is defined in clause 2(2) of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
means a party who is cross-examining a witness.
is defined in clause 11 of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
[def subst Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[83], effective 1 January 2009]
means any record of information, and includes:
anything on which there is writing, or
anything on which there are marks, figures, symbols or perforations having a meaning for persons qualified to interpret them, or
anything from which sounds, images or writings can be reproduced with or without the aid of anything else, or
a map, plan, drawing or photograph.
See also clause 8 of Part 2 of this Dictionary on the meaning of "document".
has the same meaning as it has in the Electronic Transactions Act 2000 .
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[84], effective 1 January 2009]
is defined in clause 2(1) of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
of a function includes performance of a duty.
in relation to a document, means a copy of the document that has been reproduced by facsimile telegraphy.
The Commonwealth Act includes a definition of this term.

means any court (including any person or body authorised to take or receive evidence, whether on behalf of a court or otherwise and whether or not the person or body is empowered to require the answering of questions or the production of documents) of a foreign country or a part of such a country.
includes power, authority or duty.
includes the Gazette and the Teaching Services Gazette.
The Commonwealth definition of this term differs from this definition.
includes any person for the time being administering the Government of the State.
means Governor-General of the Commonwealth and includes any person for the time being administering the Government of the Commonwealth.

The Commonwealth Act does not include definitions of "Governor of a State" and "Governor-General". These definitions are covered by sections 16A and 16B of the Acts Interpretation Act 1901 of the Commonwealth.
means section 59(1) .
means evidence that is:
an assertion by a person to the effect that a defendant was, or resembles (visually, aurally or otherwise) a person who was, present at or near a place where:
the offence for which the defendant is being prosecuted was committed, or
an act connected to that offence was done,

at or about the time at which the offence was committed or the act was done, being an assertion that is based wholly or partly on what the person making the assertion saw, heard or otherwise perceived at that place and time, or
a report (whether oral or in writing) of such an assertion.
[def am Act 55 of 1997 s 3 and Sch 1]
means:
a police officer (other than a police officer who is engaged in covert investigations under the orders of a superior), or

a person appointed by or under an Australian law (other than a person who is engaged in covert investigations under the orders of a superior) whose functions include functions in respect of the prevention or investigation of offences.
means:

in relation to the Parliament of the Commonwealth — a joint sitting of the members of the Senate and of the House of Representatives convened by the Governor-General under section 57 of the Commonwealth Constitution or convened under any Act of the Commonwealth, or
in relation to a bicameral legislature of a State — a joint sitting of both Houses of the legislature convened under a law of the State.
in relation to a proceeding, means the judge, magistrate or other person before whom the proceeding is being held.
is defined in clause 9 of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
[def rep Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[85], effective 1 January 2009]
means a question asked of a witness that:
directly or indirectly suggests a particular answer to the question, or
assumes the existence of a fact the existence of which is in dispute in the proceeding and as to the existence of which the witness has not given evidence before the question is asked.

means an Australian lawyer employed in or by a government agency or other body who by law is exempted from holding an Australian practising certificate, or who does not require an Australian practising certificate, to engage in legal practice in the course of that employment.
Examples of legal counsel are in-house counsel and government solicitors.
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]
means any present or former Legislative Assembly of a Territory, and includes the Australian Capital Territory House of Assembly.
of the Australian Federal Police includes a special member or a staff member of the Australian Federal Police.
means:
the Supreme Court, or
any other court created by Parliament,
and includes any person or body (other than a court) that, in exercising a function under the law of the State, is required to apply the laws of evidence.
The Commonwealth Act does not include this definition.
[def am Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[86], effective 1 January 2009]
means an offence against or arising under an Australian law.
[def rep Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[87], effective 1 January 2009]
means section 76 .
has the meaning it has in Part 2.7 of the Legal Profession Act 2004.
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[81], effective 1 January 2009]
includes the meaning given in clause 10(2) of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
is defined in section 115 .
means:
a member of the Australian Federal Police, or
a member of the police force of a State or Territory.
has the same meaning as in the Australian Postal Corporation Act 1989 of the Commonwealth.
means a representation made otherwise than in the course of giving evidence in the proceeding in which evidence of the representation is sought to be adduced.
of a witness means a previous representation that is consistent with evidence given by the witness.
of a witness means a previous representation that is inconsistent with evidence given by the witness.
of evidence means the extent to which the evidence could rationally affect the assessment of the probability of the existence of a fact in issue.
means a person who institutes or is responsible for the conduct of a prosecution.
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[88], effective 1 January 2009]
means a document that:
forms part of the records of the Crown in any of its capacities, or
forms part of the records of the government of a foreign country, or
forms part of the records of a person or body holding office or exercising a function under or because of the Commonwealth Constitution, an Australian law or a law of a foreign country, or
is being kept by or on behalf of the Crown, such a government or such a person or body,
and includes the records of the proceedings of, and papers presented to:
an Australian Parliament, a House of an Australian Parliament, a committee of such a House or a committee of an Australian Parliament, and
a legislature of a foreign country, including a House or committee (however described) of such a legislature.
is defined in clause 2(3) and (4) of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
includes:
an express or implied representation (whether oral or in writing), or
a representation to be inferred from conduct, or
a representation not intended by its maker to be communicated to or seen by another person, or
a representation that for any reason is not communicated.
includes a stamp.
means evidence of a kind referred to in section 97(1) that a party seeks to have adduced for the purpose referred to in that subsection.
means section 97(1) .
of an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander group (including a kinship group) includes any of the traditions, customary laws, customs, observances, practices, knowledge and beliefs of the group.
[def insrt Act No 46 of 2007 s 3 and Sch 1[89], effective 1 January 2009]
is defined in section 114 .
includes the meaning given in clause 7 of Part 2 of this Dictionary.
